docs.lead_paragraph: Because drinking water in some older New York City buildings has been found to contain lead exceeding a new Federal standard, the city plans in two weeks to put a chemical in the water supply to prevent lead in pipes from seeping into the water. In disclosing the plan yesterday afternoon, city officials said the chemical, calcium orthophosphate, a relative of baking soda, would bond with metal pipes and fixtures, thinly coating the inside of pipes to seal in the lead.

headline.main: New York City Will Add Chemical to Water to Lower Lead Levels
